Text saved: People might not realise they are part of the clothing waste problem, because they often donate the clothes they don't want anymore to charities. However, charity shops are not able to sell all of these clothes. This is a special problem for **fast fashion, which is cheap clothing that is made and sold very quickly.** These clothes become unfashionable as fast as they became popular, and their quality is often too poor for them to be recycled or for people to want to buy them second-hand. Because of this, huge amounts of clothes end up being thrown away. In addition, many of the clothes that charities cannot sell are sent to other countries, which causes even more economic and environmental problems there.
